Pre-Game Insights: India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate stated that they might experiment with new faces in the final T20I against Bangladesh.
The team management is keen to follow an all-out attacking style of cricket.
Ryan ten Doeschate underlined the importance of building a strong core of players for upcoming tournaments like the 50-over Champions Trophy, T20 Asia Cup, and the 2026 T20 World Cup.
India may experiment with new faces in the final T20I against Bangladesh after sealing the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India has dominated proceedings in the two T20Is and the preceding Test series.
A consolation win at the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium may be beyond reach for Bangladesh.
Fast bowler Harshit Rana, batter Tilak Verma, spinner Ravi Bishnoi, and wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma have yet to get a game.
Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma, the misfiring openers, will look to come good in the final match.
